intro: Lasiandra osbeckioides, commonly known as the New Zealand mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of native trees such as pohutukawa and kahikatea. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pink flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are red and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Lasiandra osbeckioides plays a role in the local ecosystem, providing food for various bird species.
